title: Police release names of 2 dead from Elks Charity Lodge shooting
content:
MUSKEGON, MI -- Police have identified two of three fatal victims from Sunday morning's bloody melee outside the Elks Charity Lodge in Muskegon.
There was a total of seven people shot around 2 a.m. Sunday, Sept. 22 outside the lodge, police have confirmed.
Two of the three deceased are: Dupree Johnson, 20, and Ja'Colby Brown, 20.
The name of the third fatal shooting victim hasn't yet been released. She was 20 years old as well, police said. Family of the deceased woman hadn't yet been located by police in order for them to be officially notified, authorities said. The woman was shot and then run over by a vehicle trying to flee the scene, police said.
Also injured by gunfire was one man, who has been arrested and lodged in the Muskegon County Jail, and three others who remained hospitalized late Sunday.
The incident was reported at 2 a.m. Sunday when gunfire was heard outside the lodge at 149 Ottawa in the city of Muskegon.
Police arrived to the two males deceased outside the lodge. The injured woman had been transported to a local hospital, where she later died.
Authorities are continuing to search for the vehicle involved in the deadly incident involving the woman.
Any information about the incident should be passed on to investigators by calling the Muskegon Police Department at (231) 724-6750 or Silent Observer at (231) 722-7463.
The lodge was the same location where another shooting incident occurred earlier this year. A Muskegon man was charged with weapons offenses in connection to that June incident.
Email: hpeters@mlive.com
